An Evening with Lenny A musical tribute to Leonard Bernstein Doors open at 6:30 pm to begin Silent Auction.  Show begins at 7:30 pm The Lyric Stage Company of Boston 140 Clarendon Street, Boston Tickets: $40, $100, $250, $500 Order Tickets Now Who is the man the New York Times recognized as "one of the most prodigiously talented and successful musicians in American history," that’s Leonard Bernstein, Lenny to his friends. Tonight we honor the man who through his music, passion and inexhaustible zest for life became a household name and icon. He was an innovative, award-winning composer, conductor and multi-talented pianist. He was equally respected by Broadway Theater lovers, jazz aficionados and the classical music community. His Broadway musicals are legendary, and include ‘On the Town’, Wonderful Town, ‘Candide’ and ‘West Side Story’. He packed many lives into his 72 years until his untimely death from lung cancer in 1990. On October 25th, you are in for a treat. Boston theatre celebrities Leigh Barrett, Brian De Lorenzo, Hildy Grossman, and Scott Wahle electrify the theatre performing Bernstein’s extraordinary songs of life, love and the human condition. Under the musical direction of Timothy Evans together with the visionary direction and choreography of Ilyse Robbins, you are in for a wonderful evening. Award-winning Arts and Entertainment Critic, Joyce Kulhawik, returns to weave her magic as the evening’s emcee. There will also be additional special guests, a silent auction and raffle (rumor has it there is a Bruins’ hockey puck in the house).

Please go to www.UpstageLungCancer.org for more information, to purchase a ticket, become a patron or a benefactor, or to be a volunteer for this event.
